source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Midrib of all involucral bracts with hairs less than 2 mm long or hairs absent
Midrib of at least some outer involucral bracts with hairs 3–7 mm long, often curl- ing when dried
Outer involucral bracts erect, with copious simple or 2-fid hairs along midrib
Outer involucral bracts squarrose with recurved apices, usually lacking simple and 2-fid hairs
